pr_title: HTS: Minor updates to design and schema

timeline.message:
Minor updates to HTS Design and DBSchema

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Updated protobuf to v.0.9.0-alpha5

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: should we suffix the new ed25519 public key columns with _hex like in t_entities table? That way, it's clear the key is hex encoded
timeline.author: xin-hedera
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -61,14 +61,19 @@ create table if not exists token
     token_id            entity_id               primary key,
     created_timestamp   bigint                  not null,
     divisibility        bigint                  not null,
+    ed25519_freeze_key  varchar                 null,

replies.bodyText: Sure, we can do that. Tried to shorten the name but that's useful specificity to have.
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.message:
Added _hex to keys for clarity

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText:
I would prefer the encodings (hex and ed25519) at the end and moved so they are sorted next to the corresponding field. Example:
freeze_key
freeze_key_ed25519_hex
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,26 +58,32 @@ insert into t_transaction_results (proto_id, result) values
 -- Add token table to hold token properties
 create table if not exists token
 (
-    token_id            entity_id               primary key,
-    created_timestamp   bigint                  not null,
-    divisibility        bigint                  not null,
-    freeze_default      boolean                 not null default false,
-    freeze_key          bytea,
-    initial_supply      bigint                  not null,
-    kyc_default         boolean                 not null default false,
-    kyc_key             bytea,
-    modified_timestamp  bigint                  not null,
-    supply_key          bytea,
-    symbol              character varying(100)  not null,
-    treasury_account_id entity_id               not null,
-    wipe_key            bytea
+    token_id                entity_id               primary key,
+    created_timestamp       bigint                  not null,
+    divisibility            bigint                  not null,
+    ed25519_freeze_key_hex  varchar                 null,

timeline.bodyText: Please sync the ResponseCode.proto. You're missing the recent changes in alpha5.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,26 +58,32 @@ insert into t_transaction_results (proto_id, result) values
 -- Add token table to hold token properties
 create table if not exists token

replies.bodyText:
This PR wasn't meant to cover all the changes in alpha5 as I'm addressing them in a separate PR for importer changes.
I just wanted to add a few minor shared items.
However, it'll make the other PR smaller so I'll make the new alpha5 changes here first
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: This field is no longer and looks to have been replaced by decimals. Please do a thorough review of alpha5
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,26 +58,32 @@ insert into t_transaction_results (proto_id, result) values
 -- Add token table to hold token properties
 create table if not exists token
 (
-    token_id            entity_id               primary key,
-    created_timestamp   bigint                  not null,
-    divisibility        bigint                  not null,
-    freeze_default      boolean                 not null default false,
-    freeze_key          bytea,
-    initial_supply      bigint                  not null,
-    kyc_default         boolean                 not null default false,
-    kyc_key             bytea,
-    modified_timestamp  bigint                  not null,
-    supply_key          bytea,
-    symbol              character varying(100)  not null,
-    treasury_account_id entity_id               not null,
-    wipe_key            bytea
+    token_id                entity_id               primary key,
+    created_timestamp       bigint                  not null,
+    divisibility            bigint                  not null,

timeline.bodyText: How will this field get populated? It doesn't seem to be on any transaction. I only see it on GetTokenInfo.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,26 +58,32 @@ insert into t_transaction_results (proto_id, result) values
 -- Add token table to hold token properties
 create table if not exists token
 (
-    token_id            entity_id               primary key,
-    created_timestamp   bigint                  not null,
-    divisibility        bigint                  not null,
-    freeze_default      boolean                 not null default false,
-    freeze_key          bytea,
-    initial_supply      bigint                  not null,
-    kyc_default         boolean                 not null default false,
-    kyc_key             bytea,
-    modified_timestamp  bigint                  not null,
-    supply_key          bytea,
-    symbol              character varying(100)  not null,
-    treasury_account_id entity_id               not null,
-    wipe_key            bytea
+    token_id                entity_id               primary key,
+    created_timestamp       bigint                  not null,
+    divisibility            bigint                  not null,
+    ed25519_freeze_key_hex  varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_kyc_key_hex     varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_supply_key_hex  varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_wipe_key_hex    varchar                 null,
+    freeze_default          boolean                 not null default false,
+    freeze_key              bytea,
+    initial_supply          bigint                  not null,
+    kyc_key                 bytea,
+    modified_timestamp      bigint                  not null,
+    name                    character varying(100)  not null,
+    supply_key              bytea,
+    symbol                  character varying(32)   not null,
+    total_supply            bigint                  not null default 0,

replies.bodyText:
Total Supply currently isn't being sent across. I had highlighted this in the doc as an open question as to how they will pass it.
In the interim we can calculate as it defaults to the intialSupply at creation. After this every mint increases it by said amount and every burn decreases it.
Also noted in the open question at the bottom of the doc
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Removed wiped column. Noted logic to keep totalSupply of token up to date
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: We should switch kyc to enum TokenKycStatus and freeze to TokenFreezeStatus enum
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,26 +58,32 @@ insert into t_transaction_results (proto_id, result) values
 -- Add token table to hold token properties
 create table if not exists token
 (
-    token_id            entity_id               primary key,
-    created_timestamp   bigint                  not null,
-    divisibility        bigint                  not null,
-    freeze_default      boolean                 not null default false,
-    freeze_key          bytea,
-    initial_supply      bigint                  not null,
-    kyc_default         boolean                 not null default false,
-    kyc_key             bytea,
-    modified_timestamp  bigint                  not null,
-    supply_key          bytea,
-    symbol              character varying(100)  not null,
-    treasury_account_id entity_id               not null,
-    wipe_key            bytea
+    token_id                entity_id               primary key,
+    created_timestamp       bigint                  not null,
+    divisibility            bigint                  not null,
+    ed25519_freeze_key_hex  varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_kyc_key_hex     varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_supply_key_hex  varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_wipe_key_hex    varchar                 null,
+    freeze_default          boolean                 not null default false,
+    freeze_key              bytea,
+    initial_supply          bigint                  not null,
+    kyc_key                 bytea,
+    modified_timestamp      bigint                  not null,
+    name                    character varying(100)  not null,
+    supply_key              bytea,
+    symbol                  character varying(32)   not null,
+    total_supply            bigint                  not null default 0,
+    treasury_account_id     entity_id               not null,
+    wipe_key                bytea
 );
 
 --- Add token_account table to capture token-account info such as frozen, kyc and wipe status
 create table if not exists token_account
 (
     id                  serial              primary key,
     account_id          entity_id           not null,
+    associated          boolean             not null default false,
     created_timestamp   bigint              not null,
     frozen              boolean             not null default false,
     kyc                 boolean             not null default false,

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, that's more explicit. Probably have to add 2 new tables to persist the enums also
token_kyc_statuses and token_freeze_statuses
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: I don't think the enum tables are necessary. I doubt these will ever change unlike response codes and transaction types.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: I don't see a wipe boolean anymore. How does this get populated?
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,26 +58,32 @@ insert into t_transaction_results (proto_id, result) values
 -- Add token table to hold token properties
 create table if not exists token
 (
-    token_id            entity_id               primary key,
-    created_timestamp   bigint                  not null,
-    divisibility        bigint                  not null,
-    freeze_default      boolean                 not null default false,
-    freeze_key          bytea,
-    initial_supply      bigint                  not null,
-    kyc_default         boolean                 not null default false,
-    kyc_key             bytea,
-    modified_timestamp  bigint                  not null,
-    supply_key          bytea,
-    symbol              character varying(100)  not null,
-    treasury_account_id entity_id               not null,
-    wipe_key            bytea
+    token_id                entity_id               primary key,
+    created_timestamp       bigint                  not null,
+    divisibility            bigint                  not null,
+    ed25519_freeze_key_hex  varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_kyc_key_hex     varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_supply_key_hex  varchar                 null,
+    ed25519_wipe_key_hex    varchar                 null,
+    freeze_default          boolean                 not null default false,
+    freeze_key              bytea,
+    initial_supply          bigint                  not null,
+    kyc_key                 bytea,
+    modified_timestamp      bigint                  not null,
+    name                    character varying(100)  not null,
+    supply_key              bytea,
+    symbol                  character varying(32)   not null,
+    total_supply            bigint                  not null default 0,
+    treasury_account_id     entity_id               not null,
+    wipe_key                bytea
 );
 
 --- Add token_account table to capture token-account info such as frozen, kyc and wipe status
 create table if not exists token_account

replies.bodyText:
The wiped boolean under token_account is still there. It didn't get removed.
It's populated as false by default when a TokenAccount is created.
On a TokenWipe transaction it would be set to true
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText:
Circling back wipe isn't really a state as initially thought. Rather an action that essentially burns tokens from a single account and reduces it's amount and total supply.
As such I should remove wiped
I believe this is what you may have been referring to.
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.message:
Updated doc, transaction types and migration based on updates from alpha5

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: Just freeze_status and kyc_status like in TokenRelationship. All these fields are already related to the token so no need to prefix it as it's assumed.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -71,14 +71,13 @@ To support the goals the following database schema changes should be made
     -   `account_id`
     -   `associated`
     -   `created_timestamp`
-    -   `frozen`
-    -   `kyc`
     -   `modified_timestamp`
+    -   `token_freeze_status` (FreezeNotApplicable = 0, Frozen = 1, Unfrozen = 2)

timeline.bodyText: I've asked Michael to adjust the field name to match the transaction body name. So this will soon be TOKENCREATE and TOKENDELETE. Some others are changing too.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -91,13 +90,13 @@ To support the goals the following database schema changes should be made
 ```sql
     insert into t_transaction_types (proto_id, name) values
          (28, 'UNCHECKEDSUBMIT'),
-         (29, 'TOKENCREATE'),
-         (30, 'TOKENTRANSFER'),
+         (29, 'TOKENCREATION'),

replies.bodyText:
Sounds good, will leave as is to match protobuf and update with alpha6 I guess.
Or are you suggesting leave as is without the change since Michael change will match what is in master right now?
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText:
Thanks. Went with ensuring code matches protobuf versions.
When alpha6 comes out I can change it back to TOKENCREATE and TOKENDELETE
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.message:
Updated doc and schema for token status and remove wipe column

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>
